definition: fellow townsman/fellow villager/sb from the same hometown

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
country or countryside/native place/home village or town/township (PRC administrative unit)

definition: person from the same village, town, or province
a relative (i.e. family relation)/CL:門|门[men2],個|个[ge4],位[wei4]
native place/place of origin/home state or region
fellow countryman (from the same village)/local people/villager/the folks back home
brothers/younger brother/CL:個|个[ge4]/I, me (humble term used by men in public speech)/brotherly/fraternal
(dialect) close childhood friend whom one grew up with/a couple who grew up as childhood friends
eldest brother/big brother (polite address for a man of about the same age as oneself)/gang leader/boss
younger male cousin via female line
another part of the country/some other place
